title: Your Monday Briefing: Blinken in Beijing
description: Also, Times graphics show how Russia likely blew up Ukraine’s dam.

title: Northern India Endures Heat Wave, and a Wave of Deaths
description: Some doctors believe the high number of fatalities is tied to the temperatures. But the authorities are still trying to determine how many people died and what exactly killed them.

title: JERUSALEM
description: The change could accelerate the construction of thousands of new houses in the occupied territory and puts a far-right minister in charge of giving approvals.

title: Uganda Reels From Deadly Terror Attack
description: It was one of the worst terrorist acts to hit the nation in decades, as militants burned down dormitories with students still inside and hacked others to death.

title: Pope Francis Thanks Well-Wishers for Support During Hospital Stay
description: The pontiff, giving a public address for the first time since undergoing abdominal surgery, expressed gratitude for the “affection, care and friendship” he had received.

title: The Tyranny of Relentless Positivity
description: Samantha Irby is akin to our poet laureate of peevishness.

title: Ukrainian Forces Claim Strike on Russian Ammunition Dump as Counteroffensive Continues
description: Kyiv said Sunday that its forces had destroyed the facility in a Russian-occupied area of the south, where Ukraine has been fighting to recapture territory.

title: Readers in Asia: Tell Us About Your Hometown’s Foods
description: We may include your response in the Asia Pacific Morning Briefing.

title: Indonesian Official Accused of Enslaving People
description: Families in Indonesia thought they were sending their sons to a rehab facility run by a powerful local official. Those who stayed there say it was a brutal human slavery operation.

title: Egypt Is Upset by a Dutch Exhibit About Afrocentrism
description: A new exhibit in the Netherlands explores how Black musicians have drawn inspiration and pride from the idea that ancient Egypt was an African culture. Egyptians say it distorts their history and identity.

title: Egypt Is Upset by a Dutch Exhibit About Afrocentrism
description: A new exhibit in the Netherlands explores how Black musicians have drawn inspiration and pride from the idea that ancient Egypt was an African culture. Egyptians say it distorts their history and identity.

title: Why a New Coal Plant in Bangladesh Keeps Running Out of Coal
description: The problems are an early warning for countries, especially poorer ones, that are investing in new coal-burning plants even as solar and wind get cheaper.
